meanings.definition: A piece of magnetite or other naturally magnetized mineral, able to be used as a magnet.
meanings.sent1: The lodestone pulled the iron filings towards it.
meanings.sent2: She used the lodestone to find her way in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid the lodestone in the pile of acorns.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a lodestone, drawing everyone closer to him.
meanings.sent5: The lodestone's magnetic power was so strong, it amazed the scientists.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the focus of attention or attraction.
meanings.sent1: The new art exhibit became the lodestone of the town.
meanings.sent2: Her infectious laughter was the lodestone of the party.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy became the lodestone of the family's affection.
meanings.sent4: His charisma acted like a lodestone, attracting followers wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The bright neon sign was the lodestone that guided them through the bustling city streets.
